channel.title: 2019 on Velociraptor - Digging deeper!

item.title: Recovering deleted NTFS Files with Velociraptor
item.description: By Mike Cohen On a recent engagement we responded to an intrusion where the attacker has added a new scheduled task to the Windows Task Scheduler directory (%systemroot%\System32\Task) some time ago. This is a common TTP for achieving persistence (See Mitre Att&ck). Unfortunately the actual task file was later removed and event logs were cycled past the time of interest. In that case we were able to use Velociraptor to employ some deep forensic techniques and with a bit of luck were able to recover the deleted task file.
